Legacy Document

Important: The information in this document is obsolete and should not be used for new development.

Inside Macintosh: Programmer's Guide to MacApp /
Preface - About This Book

Where to Get More Information

Books published by Addison-Wesley, such as Inside Macintosh, are available at commercial bookstores. Books and manuals published by Apple, as well as the Inside Macintosh series from Addison-Wesley and other technical books, are available through ADC, which is described in the next section.

Classroom courses, development tools, utilities, sample code, technical notes, and other materials of interest to Macintosh application developers are available from ADC, Developer University, and Developer Technical Services (DTS), as well as from a number of other vendors. Information for contacting ADC, Developer University, and DTS is provided in the following sections.

Apple also maintains several World Wide Web pages for Apple developers. These pages are grouped under the site Developer Services Products. Here's how to get there:

http://dev.info.apple.com

Note
Where information is supplied in this book on World Wide Web sites, every effort has been made to provide current, accurate Web addresses and other information. However, these sites should be considered subject to change.

MacApp Web Page

MacApp has its own Web page, available at the location

http://www.devtools.apple.com/macapp/
MacApp's Web page provides recent announcements, as well as information on ordering, training, support, software updates, and future directions. It also contains links to related pages, including the Apple Developer Catalog, Developer University, and Developer Technical Support pages.

Comments

Comments, suggestions, and corrections for this book are welcome, and should be sent to the following address:

mabugs@devtools.apple.com
Comments on MacApp itself should be sent to the same address.
